title: Watch: US Reporter Hops Onto Vintage Car During Auto Show & Strikes A Pose, Gets Sacked
text:
It was not a good day for Angel Cardenas, a California-based TV reporter who lost his job after he was filmed jumping on vintage cars during reporting. A correspondent with KMAX-TV, he was reporting from the Sacramento International Auto Show on the final day.

As he couldn’t get any car representative to talk to him he decided to lay on one of the cars that were on display. This incident didn’t go down well with people on social media and they called this behaviour ‘inappropriate’ and the person ‘shameless’.

“I feel like a kid in a candy store without the owner because you can do anything,” Cardenas is heard saying on camera. He found a baby pink Ford Thunderbird, but when he opened the car’s door to hop inside, he accidentally hit the car next to it.

Watch the video here:

He was fired after the producer of the auto show reached out to the General Manager of the channel.

“I may have crossed the line a bit, but my intentions were never to disrespect the owners of the vehicles, although it seemed that way,” Cardenas wrote in a message to the channel, reportedly told Buzzfeed. “It was really a dumb choice on my part,” the journalist admitted.
